article.title: Raytheon Awarded Airport Passenger Screening Equipment Services Contract
article.author: Henry Kenyon
article.text: The Transportation Security Administration (TSA) has awarded Raytheon Company an $88 million contract to install passenger checkpoint screening equipment at airports nationwide. The task order was issued under the TSA's Security Equipment Integration Services contract. Raytheon will be responsible for installing equipment that includes a wide range of technologies. The contract began March 24 and ends March 23, 2011.
